quizzes.question: Which property scales the image so that both width and height fit inside the content area?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The background-size Values[/h1]

The two other possible values for background size are the keywords [b]contain[/b] and [b]cover[/b]. 

The [b]contain [/b]keyword scales the image so that it fits the container. 
In other words, the image will grow or shrink proportionally, but the width and height will not exceed the container's dimensions:

CSS syntax looks like this: [code format="css" codeId="609"]background-size: [b]contain;[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2697" width="100%"]
background-size also accepts the [b]cover [/b]keyword. The image is scaled to fit the entire container; however, if that has a different aspect ratio, the image will be cropped:

CSS syntax looks like this: [code format="css" codeId="610"]background-size:[b] cover;[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2698" width="100%"]
